snippet: Researchers are turning their attention to the naturally occurring diseases in dogs, horses, sheep and pigs, whose physiology and anatomy more closely resemble that of humans.
abstract: Some medical researchers, frustrated with using rodents as test subjects, are turning their attention to naturally occurring diseases in animals who have closer physiological and anatomical relationships to human beings; shift has occurred as human medical institutions work more closely with veterinary hospitals, producing a wide body of work under both disciplines.
lead_paragraph: Researchers are turning their attention to the naturally occurring diseases in dogs, horses, sheep and pigs, whose physiology and anatomy more closely resemble that of humans.

headline.seo: Vets and Physicians Find Parallels in Medical Research
headline.main: Vets and Physicians Find Research Parallels
headline.print_headline: Vets and Physicians Find Research Parallels
